00039 template<class T>
00040 class UnlabeledMultiArg : public MultiArg<T>
00041 {
00042 
00043   // If compiler has two stage name lookup (as gcc >= 3.4 does)
00044   // this is requried to prevent undef. symbols
00045   using MultiArg<T>::_ignoreable;
00046   using MultiArg<T>::_hasBlanks;
00047   using MultiArg<T>::_extractValue;
00048   using MultiArg<T>::_typeDesc;
00049   using MultiArg<T>::_name;
00050   using MultiArg<T>::_description;
00051   using MultiArg<T>::_alreadySet;
00052   using MultiArg<T>::toString;
00053 
00054 public:
00055     
00073   UnlabeledMultiArg( const std::string& name,
00074                      const std::string& desc,
00075                      bool req,
00076                      const std::string& typeDesc,
00077                      bool ignoreable = false,
00078                      Visitor* v = NULL );

00186 template<class T>
00187 UnlabeledMultiArg<T>::UnlabeledMultiArg(const std::string& name, 
00188                                         const std::string& desc, 
00189                                         bool req,
00190                                         const std::string& typeDesc,
00191                                         bool ignoreable,
00192                                         Visitor* v)
00193   : MultiArg<T>("", name, desc,  req, typeDesc, v)
00194 { 
00195   _ignoreable = ignoreable;
00196   OptionalUnlabeledTracker::check(true, toString());
00197 }
00198 
00199 template<class T>
00200 UnlabeledMultiArg<T>::UnlabeledMultiArg(const std::string& name, 
00201                                         const std::string& desc, 
00202                                         bool req,
00203                                         const std::string& typeDesc,
00204                                         CmdLineInterface& parser,
00205                                         bool ignoreable,

00207   : MultiArg<T>("", name, desc,  req, typeDesc, v)
00208 { 
00209   _ignoreable = ignoreable;
00210   OptionalUnlabeledTracker::check(true, toString());
00211   parser.add( this );
00212 }

00243 
00244 template<class T>
00245 bool UnlabeledMultiArg<T>::processArg(int *i, std::vector<std::string>& args) 
00246 {
00247 
00248   if ( _hasBlanks( args[*i] ) )
00249     return false;
00250 
00251   // WEL: Do no allow unlabeld args that start with "-". If they are
00252   // allowed, then the parser cannot detect invalid options!
00253 
00254   if ( _ignoreable && Arg::ignoreRest() )
00255     return false;
00256 
00257   if (args[*i].find_first_of( Arg::flagStartString() ) == 0)
00258     return false;
00259 
00260   // never ignore an unlabeled multi arg
00261   // WEL: except for those that start with a "-"
00262 
00263 
00264   // always take the first value, regardless of the start string 
00265   _extractValue( args[(*i)] );
00266 
00267   /*
00268   // continue taking args until we hit the end or a start string 
00269   while ( (unsigned int)(*i)+1 < args.size() &&
00270       args[(*i)+1].find_first_of( Arg::flagStartString() ) != 0 &&
00271             args[(*i)+1].find_first_of( Arg::nameStartString() ) != 0 ) 
00272     _extractValue( args[++(*i)] );
00273   */
00274 
00275   _alreadySet = true;
00276 
00277   return true;
00278 }
00279 
00280 template<class T>
00281 std::string UnlabeledMultiArg<T>::shortID(const std::string& val) const
00282 {
00283   std::string id = "<" + _typeDesc + "> ...";
00284 
00285   return id;
00286 }
00287 
00288 template<class T>
00289 std::string UnlabeledMultiArg<T>::longID(const std::string& val) const
00290 {
00291   std::string id = "<" + _typeDesc + ">  (accepted multiple times)";
00292 
00293   return id;
00294 }
00295 
00296 template<class T>
00297 bool UnlabeledMultiArg<T>::operator==(const Arg& a) const
00298 {
00299   if ( _name == a.getName() || _description == a.getDescription() )
00300     return true;
00301   else
00302     return false;
00303 }
00304 
00305 template<class T>
00306 void UnlabeledMultiArg<T>::addToList( std::list<Arg*>& argList ) const
00307 {
00308   argList.push_back( const_cast<Arg*>(static_cast<const Arg* const>(this)) );
00309 }

00311 }
